text: Bottle @ Mikes House. Cloudy golden orange beer with white foam. Big white grape, white wine, and lemon on the nose. Some nice vanilla and oak. Has a nice bit of stone fruit like nectarine and apricot to it as well. There is just a touch of sweetness in the form of vanilla, melon, and stone fruits. Decent enough damp and slightly briny funk. Another nice offering from Sante Adairius.

750mL shared at Woodshop 10. Clear straw to orange pour with healthy foam. Nose is peach cobbler, rich and inviting. Flavor begins with prickly carbonation, medium acid, slight salty character, ripe peach, angel food cake, with some puckering sourness towards the end. No acetic character thankfully. Comes across as a stonefruit forward sour saison with some of that heaven in a bottle house yeast character from the Cellarman base.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy juicy yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of peach, esters, oaky, grapes, sweet pear, melony, wheaty, citrussy. Taste is sweet, vinous, light lactic tart, esters, pear, oak, sweet tropical fruit, floral, citrus.
Bottle @ Moving day tasting. HAzy golden pour with a frothy head. Tons of fruity notes, apricots, stone fruits, apples, funky, some herbal notes and a dry finish. Really good!

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of melon, sweet pear, peach, funky brett, pomelo peel, sweet juicy citrus notes, tropical notes, slight banana peel and floral notes. Awesome! The taste has oak, citrus, pear, peach, funky basement, floral notes, orange, pomelo and a juicy tartness. This is enjoyable stuff!

Bottle thanks to bursprak. Pours a hazy yellow with a nice, white head. Aroma has lots of citrus, salvie, pears, pomelo, wheaty malts, oak, light dry funk, light acidic, light esters. Taste is sour, dry, funky, more floral than aroma, oaky dry finish, light spicy herbs. High carbonation and a crisp, smooth body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
October 23, 2015 - taster glass sample at Darkness Eve. Bottle shared by Steve. Clear yellow with a lot of head.
Pours yellow hazy with a small head, aroma of brett, sulfur, leaves, leather, sourness, flavor of brett, sulfur, tiers, apricot, green tea, sourness, medium bodied, great

Bottle (750 ml). From kcherney, thanks! Split with the Québec crew. 

Appearance: Hazy yellow-golden with a small ring of white foam and some lacing. 

Aroma: Nose is quite lemony with a bit of funk, white wine notes, the Saison yeast is shining through as well, delicate cereals and brettanomyces.

Taste: Moderately tart with bright lemony notes, white wine, brettanomyces, nice funk-ish presence, delicate cereals backbone and a tiny bit of basil. 

Palate: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Delicate and clean. Lemony finish. 

Overall: Another Saison from Sante Adairius that is delicate and mightily drinkable while being complex and really flavorful. The barrel treatment is subtle and very well done. Great balance and good work with the cereals. Im also impressed by how the Saison yeast in shining through despite the barrel treatment and the rather strong lemony presence. Nice one!

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow blond with decent white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, cereal, hay and light bugs. Taste is lemony, yeast, white wine barrel. This one is not overly sour. It is flavorful, but remains clean and refreshing. Another awesome saison by SARA!

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Aroma is of wild yeast, fruits, saison yeast. Taste is of wild yeast, fruits, sourness, funk, saison. Palate: Light body. Soft carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Acidity just well put. Outstanding.

Pours a really hazy yellow with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Some unsightly floaters (yeast rafts) in my glass but still a marvelous looking beer. Nose is of white wine, fruits, light dill and pepper. Taste is sour, fruity, vinous and dry. Some juicy white grapes. Body is medium, carbonation moderate and the mouthfeel just vinous. Really refreshing, really nice!

pours hazy very light but bright golden with a frothy white head, nicely lacing. lemongrass, dusty and very fruity siezohn esters, juicy lemondrops, tropical pineapple, white wine, pale honeyed maltiness, yeast. light carbonation, light body - oily; dry, pleasantly tart and juicy citrusy finish. excellent!

Bottle shared. Hazy very pale gold pour with foamy white head. Aroma is really nice, super soft grainy aroma, lemony notes, typical SARA nose, light Saison yeastiness. Taste is bready, lemony, nice and tart. Palate is light bodied, just enough carbonation. Tasty.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad.

Light yellow hazy body with a white head. Lovely aroma of funk, wild yeast, citrus. Gentle acetic character and elegant sourness. Phenomenal. World class wild ale.
Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a cloudy gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma is funk, oak, lemon zest. Similar flavor to nose, tart, light sourness, very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Hazy white-blond with white ring. Sour aroma of peach yogurt, mildly sour, fruity and rich taste. Refreshing, medium-bodied, smooth texture, long, fruit juice finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks beerandbeyond. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Lovely funky aroma with apples, citrus, barnyard, oak and a bit of leathery hint. Dry sourish flavor, oaky, funky, with fresh juicy fruitiness. Pretty rounded mouthfeel. Really delicious and very refreshing. Wonderful.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of light funkiness/tartness, some notes of light fruits, light malts, some hints of oak, and some more tartness. Flavor really good with a great funkiness and tartness and light malts and notes of fruits. Average texture. A really good beer.

Thanks Dave! Pour is a hazy glowing golden straw with 1 finger micro bubbled head. Nose is awesome combo of eggy and sante house strain funk with a citrusy and slightly metallic tone. Rich and yeasty goodness. Rich and thick body. Sharp up front to a malty citrusy end. Taste is Bernice like. Yeasty, eggy, citrusy sante saison especial. Really nice. Richer/fuller than 5 and 6. Really amazing.

Bottle shared at the brewery. Pours an opaque orangey gold with a sticky white film. Acidic orange juice and unripe stone fruit. So fruity. Flavor has acidic clementine and reminds me a lot of Bernice but more acidic and less carbonated. Great stuff.

Bottle shared by Felipe and Mayur - thanks men! Pours hazy golden, small white head, some lacing. Aroma is a bit funky, basement, oak tannins, lots of fruitiness, lemon zest. Flavor is medium tart, fruity, lemon, light funk, some pit fruitiness. Medium body, Really tasty beer. I neeeeed to get ahold of a BA cellarman.
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2014 Bottle. Weekly tasting. Pours gold white head. Nose/taste of white peach, white wine, oak, sour funk. Medium body.
Bottle. Very light yellow pour with light head. Fresh Brett, oak, fruit and tart aromas. Flavors are similar, nice Brett and funk tones, should be nice with age.
Sample at brewery, Hazy golden yellow pour. Notes of Sour peach and grapefruit, lemons, and funk. Really nice Brett and citrus fruit profile in this beauty. Medium body and carbonation. Excelllent

16e bottle. 4 parts Barrel-Aged Cellarman and 1 part Barrel aged saison with Bug Country yeast. Aroma is fruity and peachy with light lemon peel, medium acidic aroma, light oak and very light funk. The beer pours golden color, with slight haze and small white that leaves a layer of bubbles over the liquid. Flavor is funky peach, light melon, lemon peel, vanilla, oaky must, light lacto/yogurt character, medium sweetness, light funk. The body is medium-light with soft carbonation and a full finish. After taste has moderate tartness, moderate fruitiness, some yeast bitterness. Overall, its a creamy and full bodied blend that has a full and fruity finish. The bug country saison on draft was really horsey and dry, but since the blend was mostly BA Cellarman not a whole lot came through. It is not very dry which makes the barrel aging and yeast flavor profile really shine.

From notes taken while drinking the beer from a tap at the brewery. 
Aroma is fruity with tropical fruit and stone fruit as well as a moderat citrus note and a moderate fruitiness. Medium oak and light tannins with some light acidity. 
Pours a cloudy, pale yellow gold with a small white head with good retention and light film. Light lacing as well. 
Flavor is moderately tart with nice citrus notes. Light tropical fruit. Medium light oak and oak tannins. Medium low bitterness. Faint funkiness. 
Mouthfeel is medium low bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer. Similar to BA Cellarman but with a bit of funkiness as well. Good tartness and oak notes with quite a bit of fruit and citrus.
